bullets: Customer Success Manager uses ChatGPT Enterprise most days for writing-heavy workflows: follow-ups, success plans, QBR agendas, and clearer internal updates.
Primary value is speed + structure: drafts produced quickly, then edited for accuracy and customer-specific tone; estimated 2–5 hours/week saved.
Most usage is standard chat plus Canvas for polishing and formatting; occasional Deep Research for public industry/competitor context.
Main constraint is sensitive/precise content (contract language, pricing, customer-specific details), which leads to manual work and cautious prompting.
Requested improvements: vetted prompt-template library for common CSM tasks and short office hours to share workflows/pitfalls.

use_case.title: CSM follow-ups and success planning from meeting notes (notes → summary → plan)
use_case.goal: Produce customer-actionable follow-ups (recap, decisions, risks, next steps) and adoption plans quickly with clear structure and tone.
workflow_steps: Prompt ChatGPT Enterprise to generate a structured recap (decisions/risks/next steps) plus a draft adoption plan.
Use Canvas to polish wording and improve formatting/readability for customer-ready output.
Sanity-check accuracy vs. notes; adjust tone to match customer language; remove overly specific details.
Send customer email and create a short internal summary.
use_case.chatgpt_enterprise_role: Drafting and structuring written outputs (customer emails, action plans, summaries); formatting/polish via Canvas; occasional public-context research via Deep Research.
outcome_positive: Faster turnaround: solid draft in ~10 minutes plus 10–15 minutes editing vs. prior 30–45 minutes manual rewrite.
Improved clarity/structure and ability to send same-day follow-ups.
More consistent quality for writing-heavy deliverables (follow-ups, QBR prep, success plans).
outcome_negative: Cannot use for sensitive customer specifics or exact contract/pricing/legal language; requires caution and sometimes slows workflow.
Requires manual verification and edits for accuracy and customer-specific tone.

dimensions.label: How often used in a typical work week (1–5)
Ease of dealing with sensitivity/precision constraints day-to-day (1–5)
How supported they feel to use ChatGPT Enterprise well (1–5)

ratings.notes: User reports using ChatGPT Enterprise “most days” in short bursts, with strongest fit/impact for structured writing tasks; constraints around confidentiality and exactness reduce ease.

wins: Time savings and faster same-day customer follow-ups
Better structure and clarity in customer-ready communications
Canvas improves readability/formatting for polished drafts
blockers: Avoidance of sensitive customer specifics and exact contract/legal/pricing language
Extra caution/sanitization and manual verification can slow work
feature_requests: Library of vetted prompt templates for common CSM workflows
Short office hours to share workflows and pitfalls
enablement_needs: More shared examples and best-practice routines (e.g., ask for structure first, then tighten tone)
Team-wide knowledge sharing beyond ad hoc Slack posts and personal experimentation
risks_or_caveats: Risk concerns around leaking sensitive details into prompts (drives non-use or generic prompting)
Need for precision in legal/contract contexts requires manual drafting/validation

quotes.quote: Drafting customer-facing emails, summarizing meeting notes into action items, turning a messy set of notes into a clean success plan, brainstorming agendas for QBRs, and rewriting internal updates to be clearer.
Mainly standard chat, but I did use Canvas to polish the email and the action-plan formatting.
Mostly time and clarity. I can send a higher-quality follow-up the same day instead of letting it slip, and the structure is consistently better.
Before: I’d spend 30–45 minutes... After: I get a solid draft in ~10 minutes, then spend another 10–15 editing for accuracy and tone.
When I’m dealing with sensitive customer specifics, exact contract language, or anything where precision has to be perfect and I don’t want to risk leaking details into a prompt.
quotes.topic: When they avoid using it / constraints

quotes.quote: A small library of vetted prompt templates + short office hours where people can share real workflows and pitfalls.

ambiguity_notes: No explicit mention of which internal systems/templates are used when avoiding ChatGPT Enterprise.
No explicit measurement of quality outcomes beyond self-reported clarity/structure and time saved.
